meta.@content: Takes a communication-message input from a traversing vehicle (such as an AUV or submarine), then sets up the route/relay time delays, directions, animation and visualization of SeaWeb buoy communications among each other, all the way to the SeaWeb RACOM RF-relay buoy at the surface.
Under development, need to check timing and routing table
An experimental version of X3D JSON encoding is used for this scene.  Status online at http://www.web3d.org/wiki/index.php/X3D_JSON_Encoding

-children.#comment: ExternProtoDeclare statements precede the scene elements utilizing them

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Produce wireframe or transparent beam cylinders. Typical uses include propeller/thruster water flow or line-of-sight sonar/radar/light beams. Negative range values invert base and apex at same relative location. Default: beam with apex at (0 0 0) and base of radius 1 in x-z plane at (1 0 0).

field.@appinfo: (communications) is transmitted signal in contact with receiver or (sensor) is a target return detected?
distance in meters along x axis
distance in meters used until eventIn range sent
whether wireframe beam is drawn
whether solid beam is drawn
meters across vertical y axis
meters across horizontal z axis
rendering color when contact=true
rendering color when contact=false
1 = fully transparent wireframe only

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Circular set of compass bearings that follow the active viewpoint set at 360/36 = 10 degree intervals. North = +X axis East = +Z axis up = +Y axis.
The CrossHair prototype provides a heads-up display (HUD) crosshair showing center of screen useful for assessing NavigationInfo lookAt point

field.@appinfo: Short description of what is animated by this DvdController.
Whether or not play mode is enabled including during startup.

Initializes how control buttons and slider are displayed. The control buttons include DIS control (i.e. Master Ghost Local) and Playback control (i.e. Reset to Start Fast Rewind Rewind Pause Play Fast Forward Reset to End). Possible values are (case sensitive): ALL DIS_ONLY PLAYBACK_ONLY SLIDER_ONLY DIS_PLAYBACK DIS_SLIDER PLAYBACK_SLIDER and NONE.

Sets how control buttons and slider are displayed. The control buttons include DIS control (i.e. Master Ghost Local) and Playback control (i.e. Reset to Start Fast Rewind Rewind Pause Play Fast Forward Reset to End). Possible values are (case sensitive): ALL DIS_ONLY PLAYBACK_ONLY SLIDER_ONLY DIS_PLAYBACK DIS_SLIDER PLAYBACK_SLIDER and NONE.
Default button color.
Button color when selected by user.
Default label color.
Label color when selected by user.
Modified screen location and distance (for size).
Time for complete loop cycle in seconds.
Factor used to determine the speed increase/decrease for Fast Rewind and Fast Forward action.
isMaster isRemote and isLocal are booleans represent a 3-way toggle. Only one of them can have a true value at any time.
isMaster isRemote and isLocal are booleans represent a 3-way toggle. Only one of them can have a true value at any time.
isMaster isRemote and isLocal are booleans represent a 3-way toggle. Only one of them can have a true value at any time.
isPaused and isRunning always have opposite values. When isPaused is true isRunning will be false and vice versa.
isPaused and isRunning always have opposite values. When isPaused is true isRunning will be false and vice versa.
Enable/disable console output for troubleshooting.

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Line grid authoring tool to enable precise measurement of objects in 3D space - fixed position. Oriented along XZ plane size 20m by 20m.

field.@appinfo: default unscaled size: 10m by 10m
-X axis
-Z axis
+X axis
+Z axis
label location offset (in meters) to improve readability
Position of buoy.
Position of buoy.
Position of target of transmission.
Position of target of transmission.
Id number of target.
Id number of target.
Enable buoy for transmission.
Enable buoy for transmission.
Start transmission.
Start transmission.
Duration in seconds needed to transmit message (does not include transmissionTimeDelay or propagation delay).
Duration in seconds needed to transmit message (does not include transmissionTimeDelay or propagation delay).
Time delay before transmission begins.
Time delay before transmission begins.
Select between directional (true) or omni-directional (false) transmission.
Select between directional (true) or omni-directional (false) transmission.
Determine which buoy type to use. "Racom" for Racom Buoy. "Telesonar" for Telesonar Repeater.
Determine which buoy type to use. "Racom" for Racom Buoy. "Telesonar" for Telesonar Repeater.
Sound speed in water default value 1500 m/s
Sound speed in water default value 1500 m/s

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: ViewPositionOrientation prototype provides local position and orientation as user navigates with optional console output

field.@appinfo: Whether or not ViewPositionOrientation sends output to console.
Output internal trace messages for debugging this node - developer use only can be ignored.
Ability to turn output tracing on/off at runtime.
Output local position.
Output local orientation.
MFString value of new Viewpoint for example: <Viewpoint position="20 15 20" orientation="-0.516 0.83 0.212 0.9195"/>

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Reads waypoints and legSpeeds/legDurations/defaultSpeed to provide a customizable position/orientation interpolator.

-children.#comment: Priority of use: legSpeeds (m/sec), legDurations (seconds), defaultSpeed (m/sec)

field.@appinfo: Short description of what is animated by this WaypointInterpolator.
Waypoints being traversed with interpolation of intermediate positions and orientations.
Add another single waypoint to array of waypoints recalculate interpolator values.
Replace all waypoints recalculate interpolator values.
Whether to pitch child geometry (such as a vehicle) up or down to match vertical slope
Units m/sec. If used array lengths for legSpeeds and legDurations must be one less than number of waypoints.
Units in seconds. If used array lengths for legSpeeds and legDurations must be one less than number of waypoints.
Units m/sec.
turningRate (degrees/second) also determines standoff distance prior to waypoint where turn commences. If 0 turns are instantaneous.
Output calculation summing all leg durations, useful for setting TimeSensor cycleInterval. Units in seconds.
exposed PositionInterpolator and OrientationInterpolator setting
exposed PositionInterpolator setting
exposed OrientationInterpolator setting
default color for non-active line segments
highlightSegmentColors must contain two color values for each endpoint of the highlight segment.
1.0 is completely transparent, 0.0 is completely opaque.
allowed values: none; waypoints (produce labels at each waypoint); or interpolation (produce single moving label at interpolator time course speed location)
allowed values: altitude depth (negate Y value) none
heightLabel relative location
heightLabel text size
heightLabel text color
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress
Output the number of waypoints totalDistance and totalDuration to console upon initialization
default color for vertical drop-line segments
1.0 is completely transparent, 0.0 is completely opaque.

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: BuoyCommunicationsGrid prototype takes a communication-message input from a traversing vehicle (such as an AUV or submarine) then sets up the route/relay time delays directions animation and visualization of SeaWeb buoy communications among each other all the way to the SeaWeb RACOM RF-relay buoy at the surface.

field.@appinfo: array of SeaWebBuoy nodes index starting at 0
2D array of routing connectivity for buoys consisting either of index of next buoy in line -1 for same buoy or else 0 for no route connection. legal values range [-1..n-1] for n buoys.
set position of entity sending the message
position of entity sending the message
set position of entity receiving the message
position of entity receiving the message
send it! (note: maybe should rename as 'activate')
array of SeaWebBuoy nodes index starting at 0
2D array of routing connectivity for buoys -1 for no connection range [0..n-1] for n buoys.
set position of entity sending the message
position of entity sending the message
set position of entity receiving the message
position of entity receiving the message
send it!

// square root of sum of sum of squares
function timeSoundTravels (distance) // input: float meters, output: float seconds
// speed of sound in water = 1500 m/s

for (i=1; i < buoyArray.length; i++) // start comparison loop at second buoy

if (value != false) tracePrint ('sendMessage() exiting, passed value=' + value);
// run-time setup happens here!   execution of all buoys occurs upon returning.
// prepare the scene graph for a message sequence, then start it.
// first find shortest distances and thus closest buoys to sender and receiver

tracePrint ('senderNode and destinationNode are the same, no message sent');
// compute path (sequence of buoy IDs) from closest buoy to SeaWeb buoy
// compute full buoy-to-buoy routing paths for current sender-receiver combination
tracePrint ('currentNodeIndex=' + currentNodeIndex + ', nextNodeIndex=' + nextNodeIndex + ', tableIndex=' + tableIndex);
// check if dead end - incomplete communication path
alwaysPrint ('*** hit a dead end! no further routing possible.');
// consider not animating any buoys, i.e. whether or not partial routing allowed
// communicate from currentNodeIndex buoy to nextNodeIndex buoy
// by sending initialization values to each buoy in path:
// message, target buoy ID/position, and then compute distance/time to travel
// to set time delay of each buoy prior to start of each transmission.
// set up for next time through loop:
tracePrint ('====='); // last node to destination follows
tracePrint ('path destination found, buoy hopCount=' + hopCount + ', nodePath=' + nodePathString + ', receiver');

-children.#comment: Viewable geometry for this scene is anchored text that links to an example showing ExternProtoDeclare usage of a BuoyCommunicationsGridPrototype.
